description.narrative: Benin II - Electricity Generation Project: The Objective of the Electricity Generation Project is to: (A) increase the hours of operation for businesses and public and social services; (B) reduce reliance on costlier sources of energy; (C) reduce losses of products and perishable goods; and (D) improve productivity for users of electricity. To accomplish the Electricity Generation Project Objective, MCC Funding will be used to increase Benin's domestic generation capacity by up to 78 MW while decreasing its dependence on external energy sources, specifically by installing photovoltaic generation capacity, rehabilitating existing thermal generation units and rehabilitating and installing additional generation capacity at an existing micro-hydroelectric power plant.

condition.narrative: Prior to ID of On-Grid Tranche Funding, Gov?t adoption of an institutional framework for independent power production, including: (i) institutional roles and responsibilities within the Gov?t for soliciting, implementing and monitoring IPPs; (ii) formal process for open/fair/competitive solicitation of IPPs; and (iii) development/publication of standard PPAs.
Prior to ID of On-Grid Tranche Funding, Gov?t in compliance with Tariff Plan.
Prior to ID of On-Grid Tranche Funding, Gov?t releases competitive solicitation for an IPP for a generation project located in Benin.
Prior to ID of On-Grid Tranche Funding, The Gov?t will have provided evidence to MCC of substantial compliance with the Gov?t Arrears Payment Plan.
Prior to ID of On-Grid Tranche Funding, each of the applicable conditions to On-Grid Tranche Funding set forth in Annex VI must be met.

Prior to the Disbursement of Program Funding for the Electricity Generation Project for construction or works for assets owned, to be owned or to be purchased by SBEE, SBEE will adopt the SBEE Operations Worker Health and Safety Plan, as evidenced by (A) a resolution of the SBEE Board of Directors; and (B) the corresponding staffing plan, training plan and budget for implementing the SBEE Operations Worker Health and Safety Plan.

Prior to the Disbursement of Program Funding for the Photovoltaic Generation Activity under the Electricity Generation Project after the first anniversary following entry into force, the Government will: (A) adopt the Tariff Plan, as evidenced by a decree or other appropriate legal instrument from ARE and resolution by the Council of Ministers; and (B) provide evidence of ARE's publication of a tariff schedule, in form and substance satisfactory to MCC.
